Race.SpecificTitle: PW City Council  (HRC) -- Amend HRC - CC
Race.SummaryText:
Parishwide Proposition
(City Charter Amendment - Public Belt Railroad Commission)

Summary: This proposition amends Article V of the Home Rule Charter of the City of New Orleans relative to the Public Belt Railroad Commission.  The amendment makes the following substantive change:  reducing the number of members of the commission from the mayor and sixteen members to the mayor and nine appointed members.  The amendment proposed in this proposition is contained in Appendix "A" to Ordinance Number 24512 M.C.S.
Race.FullText: Shall Section 5-201 of the Home Rule Charter of the City of New Orleans regarding the Public Belt Railroad Commission be amended by making the additions, deletions and modifications summarized hereinabove and as fully set forth in Appendix "A" to Ordinance No. 24512 M.C.S?

Race.SpecificTitle: Pressburg E. Neigh. Imp. Dist. -- $200 Parcel Fee - CC - 4 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Pressburg East Neighborhood Improvement and Security District Proposition

Summary:  The levy of a special annual fee in the amount of two hundred dollars ($200) for four (4) years upon each parcel of real property in the Pressburg East Neighborhood Improvement and Security District for the primary object and purpose of promoting and encouraging the beautification, security and overall betterment of the Pressburg East Neighborhood Improvement and Security District.
Race.FullText: Shall the City of New Orleans levy a special annual fee, to be called the Pressburg East Neighborhood Improvement and Security District's fee, on each parcel of real property situated within the boundaries of Pressburg East Neighborhood Improvement and Security District (which District is comprised of that area of the Parish of Orleans whose boundaries are coterminous with the boundaries of the Pressburg East Neighborhood Improvement and Security District) as specified by Resolution R-11-404 of the City Council of New Orleans in the amount of two hundred dollars ($200) annually for four (4) years, beginning in 2012 and ending in 2015, with an estimated $210,000 expected annually to be collected from the levy of the parcel fee for the entire year, to be used solely and exclusively for the primary object and purpose of promoting and encouraging the beautification, security and overall betterment of the Pressburg East Neighborhood Improvement and Security District, as determined and managed by the Board of Commissioners of the Pressburg East Neighborhood Improvement and Security District which security shall be supplemental to and not in lieu of personnel and services provided in the Pressburg East Neighborhood Improvement and Security District by the New Orleans Police Department?

Race.SpecificTitle: Lk Barrington Subd. Imp. Dist. -- $350 Parcel Fee - CC - 8 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Lake Barrington Subdivision Improvement District Proposition

Summary:  The levy of a special annual fee in the amount of Three Hundred Fifty Dollars ($350), for eight (8) years upon each parcel of real property in the Lake Barrington Subdivision Improvement District for the primary object and purpose of promoting and encouraging the beautification, security and overall betterment of the Lake Barrington Subdivision Improvement District.
Race.FullText: Shall the City of New Orleans levy a special annual fee to be called the Lake Barrington Subdivision Improvement District's fee, on each parcel of real property situated within the boundaries of the Lake Barrington Subdivision Improvement District (which District is comprised of that area of the Parish of Orleans whose boundaries are coterminous with the boundaries of the Lake Barrington Subdivision) as specified by Resolution R-11-386 of the City Council of New Orleans in the amount of Three Hundred Fifty Dollars ($350), annually for eight (8) years, beginning in 2012 and ending in 2019 with an estimated $71,400 expected annually to be collected from the levy of the parcel fee for the entire year, to be used solely and exclusively for the primary object and purpose of promoting and encouraging the beautification, security and overall betterment of the Lake Barrington Subdivision Improvement District as determined and managed by the Board of Commissioners of the Lake Barrington Subdivision Improvement District which security shall be supplemental to and not in lieu of personnel and services provided in the Lake Barrington Subdivision Improvement District by the New Orleans Police Department?
